flowchart
Class StatementSequence

java.lang.Object
  flowchart.StatementSequence
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbstractStatement
public class StatementSequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractStatement

An instance of a StatementSequence contains a list of instance(s) of AbstractStatement. It represents a sequence of statements, which can be contained in a procedure, a TRUE/FALSE body of an IF statement, or a loop body of a WHILE statement. The design of StatementSequence is based on the Composite design pattern.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: June 8, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

Field Detail

stmtSeq

protected java.util.List stmtSeq
A list of statements. The index of a statement is used as a key. The type of each element in the list is AbstractStatement.

Constructor Detail

public StatementSequence()
Constructor for a new sequence of statements.

paint

public java.util.List paint(int startX,
                            int startY)
Create a list of JGraph cells to represent this sequence of statements.

Specified by:
paint in interface AbstractStatement
Parameters:
startX - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
startY - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
Returns:
The list of cells as shown in a flowchart. The type of the elements in the list is DefaultGraphCell.
